newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway monitors Bulgaria hijack situation.
newsitem.headline: Norway monitors Bulgaria hijack situation.

text.p: Norway said on Tuesday it was closely following the situation at Varna airport in Bulgaria where a hijacker wanted to be flown to Oslo.
"We are watching this," a spokeswoman for the Justice Ministry said. "The Justice Ministry's political department and the police have been alerted. We are waiting for more information."
In Varna, an airport official said a chartered plane of the private Bulgarian Hemus Air company on a flight from Beirut to Varna had been hijacked 15 minutes before landing.
All 150 passengers on board had been freed, but crew members were kept aboard, he said.
"The plane, which landed for refuelling, will take off for Oslo shortly," a Varna airport traffic controller said.
Norway has taken a tough line on hijackers in the past.
In January 1995 Norway extradited three Iranian hijackers to Russia 16 months after they commandeered an Aeroflot airliner on a domestic flight to Oslo.
Last November, a Palestinian woman involved in the 1977 hijacking of a Lufthansa airliner to Mogadishu was put on a plane to Germany after the government rejected her final appeal.
Souhaila Andrawes is on trial in Hamburg charged with murder, attempted murder, hijacking, kidnapping and hostage-taking.
